alert.note: Alert for Allen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:37AM EST until February 17 at 7:09PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Spy Run Creek at Spy Run Creek near Park Drive At Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spy Run Creek near Park Drive At Fort Wayne. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, Spy Run Creek begins to top the northern banks near Wells Streetand Mildred Ave. At 11.0 feet, Franke Park Drive along the creek floods as drainage systems backfill. Low profile vehicles become stranded in parking lots by the playground and near the roundabout at the entrance to Franke Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
